I was seated and waited more than 5 minutes while others around me who arrived after me were taken care of. I was about to leave when my waiter Tom came up and saved the restaurant from getting a one star. He sincerely apologized about my wait and made my meal enjoyable.  I had the chicken enchiladas which were very good.  Suggestion to management, train to host staff to realize a customer hasn't been taken care of in a short period of time. The hostess past me several times and it didn't register there was a problem.

OK...so it's been 5 years.  I don't come here often, obviously!  We had a company lunch on this occasion.

The place was pretty full, and very loud.  Surprising how loud.

I ordered the steak burrito.  When it arrived it wasn't very hot.  Our orders were called in ahead of time, and we arrived punctually.  There were probably 15 of us, and they had the orders ready almost instantly.  Given the temperature I would say they cooked it well ahead.  My burrito must have been sitting around for (I would guess) 30 minutes to get that not-warm.

So how did it taste?  The flavor was not bad.  Pretty good, really.  The rice that came with it was seasoned very well, I thought.  But the steak in the burrito was a bit fatty and gristle-y.  I expect better quality meat at Chipotle or Cafe Rio, and I certainly expect better here!

All I can say is I'm glad I didn't pay the $13.50 for that burrito.  Yes, that's how much the lunch menu steak burrito cost!  If it was $7 I probably would bump to three stars.  Flavor was good, and temperature would probably have been fine if it wasn't a pre-order for a large group.  So I'll give them those.  Well, at least the benefit of the doubt on the temperature.  But the fat and gristle, plus the portion size (which was small) do not warrant a $13.50 price tag!  At that price the value just isn't there for what you get.

Service was good, especially considering the size of our group.

If there ever is a next time I will have to try something completely different.  For a burrito I could get one at Chipotle for $9 that is twice the size and almost as flavorful.

Great service. Great food. Great ambience. 

Went for lunch with coworkers and then went to their happy hour. Amazing deal on delicious cocktails. I loved their Skinny Cucumber Mules. Their appetizers were amazing! We got the seared ahi, dumplings, street tacos, spinach quesadillas, and these chips with shrimp on top of them. 

I am definitely going back to try their main entrees.

A decent southwest meal from a chain.  Kind of reminded me of a little more upscale Chili's.  Not bad, but also not great either.

The margaritas just didn't have the right sour mix. A basic margarita should have a good balance but this was just all sour and too bitter.

The trio of dips had very good queso, decent guacamole, and fair salsa.  The chips were plentiful though.

As for the main course, I had the salmon and it was utterly forgettable. Perhaps I should know better than to order fresh fish when you're not near the ocean, but it was just disappointing.  

Overall, though, a solid choice for friends to get together.

This restaurant was amazing for southwestern comfort food. Free buttery corn bread, then I ordered the guacamole, which they made table side, and then I had a fajita meal. It was delicious. Decently priced and large portions (I had plenty of leftovers)

Have been here twice within  4 days.  Both times were excellent.

On Sunday hubby and I took friends there for brunch, and we were delighted.  I ordered the Barbacoa enchiladas, and the dish was very, very good.  Everyone at the table truly enjoyed their meal, and we had excellent service.

Today I dined here with a friend and the Asian dumplings -- delicious.  Even though this dish is listed in the appetizer section it made an excellent meal for me.

Good not great.  The wife and I came for a bite at happy hour.  We sat on the patio, which was more quiet than I'd have expected based on proximity to the road.   The margarita's were really good but not the best in the area, which may keep us from going back.  Chips and queso were really solid and so was the quesadilla.  Happy hour pricing wasn't bad but wasn't great either. 

TLDR - Good spot but probably not the best in the area for what we are looking for.  Definitely worth a try though.

Solid lunch spot when you want something more than the standard soup, sandwich, salad.  I ordered some chicken medallion / side of potatoes dish and it was really good.  The queso dip was also good, too.
Cornbread!!! Complimentary cornbread after your order. I love their margarita flight, the best is the 6th Street. It's a good place for lunch and one of the best places for happy hour

This restaurant has recently gotten new owners. A few things have changed but the food is still delicious as ever. For example, they used to give out cornbread as part of the meal. Now it is $3, which is donated to charity. I think the reason they did it this way is because no one is going to throw a fit over money going to a charity. But I'm sure they will eventually just start charging for it without donating. Basically, they are cutting down costs but doing it in a "nice" way. Other than that, I always love the atmosphere, and there isn't an item on the menu that I don't like. The waiters and waitresses are usually very nice and attending. Even when the place is busy, the food comes out pretty quick. The prices are to be as expected for a nicer restaurant. If you're looking for a unique southwestern dining experience, Z-Tejas is the place!

I love going to z'Tejas. The place is always nice and friendly. The margaritas are great and I love the cornbread! My favorite dish is the gorganzola New York strip. Nothing like a sprinkle of cheese on your steak! I also enjoy the tomato basil dressing but will pass on those weird things they call croutons...

This was better than I expected.  We got there for an early dinner so they still had happy hour going on.  Happy hour is until 7 pm.  We ordered the guacamole made fresh at the table side.  This was very good but no spice even with the diced Jalapeños.  Tammy was our server and she is timely, efficient, polite, attentive, and knowledgeable of the food and drink menu. She is able to make recommendations.  I had the veggies instead of chips for the guacamole.  You can make a meal of that alone.  Fresh, cucumbers, celery and carrots.  The manager came out shortly after the first bowl of veggies and said they didn't peel them and replaced them before we even had a chance to notice.  They even pull the threads off the celery like I do.  (I thought I was the only one) we had the special.  A chicken pot pie with Cajun and green chili cream sauce.  They precooked the chunks of potato before baking them in the pie.  The Zucchini, carrots and other veggies were still crispy like I like.  We ordered a side of cornbread that must have an extra cup of sugar in it with corn kernels.  They do NOT offer a veteran's discount.

So one of our favorite little spots.  Great service as usual.  A little disappointed to see they now charge for cornbread.  Used to be free.

They allowed me to order my Diablo pasta even though it wasn't on the lunch/brunch menu which was awesome.  I tried it with shrimp this time.  Couldhave used a few more shrimp (had maybe 5) and more spice, but overall very good.

My GF had the steak burrito.  She gives it a solid C.  Sauce a little salty and the burrito is drenched in sauce and cheese.  Not a traditional burrito.  The steak inside was flavorful and rice and black beans were good.  She said she wouldn't order it again though.

Our server was awesome!  Super friendly and prompt.  Gave good reccommedations.  Very happy with the service.

Nice location and friendly service. Ally was our waitress and we could have not asked for anyone better. She really made the experience that much better. Ally came to check on us often not too much and not too little. She was quick at taking our orders and getting them right the first time(i know it also involves the cook). We started with a trio appetizer, and the guacamole was lacking seasonings, the red salsa was good with a perfect spice to it, and the Chile con queso was not impressive. My mom and I had tacos she had carne asada and I had shrimp. The proteins were really tasty and seasoned just right, but the tortillas were hard on the edges and cold. That part was unappetizing so I ended up eating two of my tacos with no tortilla which is crummy because I ordered tacos. They also brought out cornbread and that cornbread was delicious I could have ate 10 of those, but of course didn't. For sides my mom had rice and it was okay not the best a little dry. I had black beans and the Z salad. Beans were good again a little something was missing. Now the salad was delicious! It was fresh, colorful and it was refreshing eating it.
For drinks we had a tea and a lemonade the lemonade did not taste homemade, but I really enjoyed I had about 2 cups of it and that's unlike me. I tend to just drink water with my meals.

The restaurant was clean, staff was amazing, but the food was not so great considering there pricing I expected more. I think I would be willing to go back just because of the staff, but we will see.

We had a very enjoyable dinner here last night. The parking lot was PACKED so we were expecting a wait, but when we got in there was a normal crowd and no wait. Surely all those people weren't at Fleming's?

FOOD:
The chips with three salsas appetizer was ok, but kind of pointless. They bring you a skillet of cornbread automatically, so paying for chips and average salsa is kind of a waste.

We both ordered the steak, which had a very tasty chipotle cream sauce on top. Included were garlic mashed potatoes and some steamed seasonal vegetables. In our case, this meant zucchini and carrots.

The steak was cooked well, exactly as ordered and was a good cut. I had originally eyed the chile relleno until I noticed that it was stuff with, among other things, raisins and apricots. No thanks.

They have a really good brunch that I've been to as well, with a "Bloody Mary Bar" where you get the liquor and the glass and get to choose your mixer, veggies, etc.

Awful.  Just awful.

I've been to Z'Tejas 5-10x in southern California.  This was my 1st experience at this particular one in Arizona.

We came on 12/23 with a decent size party, about 10 with a few kids.  Waiter was not nice or friendly, not in the Xmas spirit let's say, but that didn't really annoy me too much.  We had a male and female waiter, I won't use their names as I don't want anyone to get in trouble/lose a job/or whatever, and they got multiple orders wrong, despite being corrected during the ordering process.  Example, kids meal, chicken strips with sweet potato fries.  
Waiter: "ok, cheeseburger with fries?"
"No, chicken strips with sweet potato fries"
"OK"

15 minutes later, cheeseburger with regular fries show up.
This happened with quite a few dishes.

Then he disappeared for the remainder of the meal.  I think he really hated our table because he kept getting stuff wrong and we continually sent stuff back (black stuff floating in milk, wrong orders, etc.).  He served other tables around us, but not ours.  Maybe he was overworked and had a bunch of other tables, but whatever.

Waitress wasn't much better, but still made errors.

Now, the food.  Like I've said before, I've been to Z'Tejas multiple times.  The food here was so bad.

Steak burrito on rice.  Steak was good, rice was horrible, needed to be cooked at least another 10 minutes.  Overall best thing that we ate.

Chicken salad.  Just awful.  horrible presentation, dry chicken, probably the wrong dressing was brought out, etc.  No redeeming qualities here.  Go to mcdonalds and get a better salad or just go to your trashcan and get a better salad.

Chicken Fingers Kids meal.  Worst chicken fingers I've ever had in my life.  How do you screw up chicken fingers?  It was like eating chicken flavored chalk.  Overcooked, under seasoned.

Tostada appetizer or whatever it was, undercooked shrimp aka grey shrimp, had to send it back.

Congratulations Z'Tejas, you found food I wouldn't eat for free.

I went here with my parents as we were visiting my grandmother nearby.  The service was some of the best we have ever experienced and the food was amazing too.  My parents and I started with the cornbread which was hot, fresh, and delicious.  For our entrees we shared three things which were all wonderful.  The trout salad had delicious and crispy red trout on top of a delicious salad which had spicy walnuts in them.  We also had both the seafood and mushroom enchilada that were even better!  We don't eat shellfish out, and they were more than willing to take out the small amount of shellfish in it.  

My parents also told the waiter it was my birthday coming up and they gave us a complimentary Ancho Fudge Pie with a birthday candle on top.  It was one of the most delicious deserts we ever had and seemed like a perfect cross between a lava cake and brownie.  Plus there is a PokeStop on the premises and as we were about ready to leave, I caught a Pikachu that I renamed Z'Tejachu.  After posting my experience on Facebook and sharing it with others, friends who have lived in the Phoenix and Austin areas also raved about their wonderful experiences at Z'Tejas.

I have an allergy to chipotle, usually I steer clear of Mexican food but my family wanted to eat here. I expressed my concerns of chipotle to our waitress Stacie and she suggested a meal and let the kitchen know about my allergy. The food was AMAZING! And the manager even came over to reassure me that my meal was being well prepared. Such a great friendly staff!! I have never been to a restaurant where they cared so much that I had a good experience. Definitely 5 stars from us!

Disclaimer: Primarily A Staff Review after Addressing our Dining Visit
In all fairness, one star less only due to the seriousness of addressing quality control.

Passing through this area of AZ, we had an impromptu lunch catching up with friends here, as they selected the venue based on a previous enjoyable dining experience. Really open dining area, bright, upbeat, and with attentive service. My experience here, I admit, can NOT be about the food per say. Hospitality in Arizona is very consistently positive. Despite our unfortunate experience here, my review will display how the treatment from the venue staff really affects a customer's dining experience in its entirety.  I chose a light appetizer of the mango salsa ahi poke on tortilla bites to share, as we had just had a huge breakfast earlier in the day. Our friends highly recommended the tacos and the mushroom enchilada.  There is a trio of salsa and chips to accompany our meal. I felt festive and ordered a summer sangria and it was delicious.  On the first bite of the ahi mango appetizer however, my guy immediately stopped chewing and pulls out a metal item.  It shocked all of us... As it was the tip of a knife or some blade of a food processor maybe, but the size of his thumbnail.  It is by far the scariest dining incident I have ever encountered.  Immediately, he excused himself to the restroom to remove anything else he had in his mouth still and came back assuring us he was okay. By that time, our server already addressed us, removed our appetizer without hesitation, asked us if we may want something else. Within moments, the manager approaches us to ensure everyone's safety. Initially, before this review, I was hesitant to report on this Yelp forum vs their corporate site, what happened, as I really did not want to make it any more unfavorable as the situation was addressed thoroughly , but in hopes that other diners may ever encounter something like this, gosh forbid, they also will have the management be as attentive and professional as we encountered.  In the end, the staff did their best to remedy this unfortunate experience.  We can see how absolutely sorry they are. They immediately addressed needing to remove any processed food items necessary or already been prepared with similar tools, and all inspection of their kitchen tools in use. I'm confident they are inspecting each item thoroughly and continuously even after this particular incident.   I ordered up a cup of chicken tortilla soup in the meantime and still enjoyed my cocktail.  My guy insisted he was okay and while his appetite, understandably enough, went away, he did not dwell on it any further. We have both worked in the dining industry and while we have never encountered something like this, we genuinely feel it could have happened to anyone, maybe even in my own kitchen.  Maybe exaggerated, maybe not. Scary, nonetheless. The staff addressed the situation very professionally. I don't know myself, what further they could have done. The manager hands me his card, even after learning we were from CA, and insists that if we ever do return, to be certain to ask for him.  He notes that he hopes we will return for another visit in the future and give them a chance again.  Without our asking or expectations, yes they ended up comping our meal in its entirety, still pologizing profusely.  We made sure to leave a generous gratuity because I can't deny our server was anything but awesome and displays genuine pride in his job, even prior to the incident at hand. He had even suggested a new brunch place to check out since we commented earlier how we loved Cracker Barrel in AZ, engaging in conversation with us. I truly feel they wish they could have done more for us.  But, we really couldn't press the issue any further as we were all safe from what we could see.  Made for an interesting lunch topic, though! Relieved no one was hurt, more than anything. Angry, no. Would we return? I feel we may.  My only wish is that they continue to check their kitchen tools and I hope nothing like this ever occurs again.  I think we all learned something invaluable from this situation.

Mine and my daughters first time here.  The service was excellent! I ordered the smothered chicken burrito, but got beef instead, however it tasted pretty good so I told them about the error but decided to eat the burrito rather than wait to hane a new one cooked.  The manager waived my dinner and brought us each free ice cream even after I told him he didn't have to. 
Everything is homemade, the customer service is phenomenal.  I'll be back!
Interesting food.. My favorite is the Mushroom enchillada and my husband loves the chile rellano, my granddaughter loves the Miso Salmon.. Great variety

A friend and I visited this location yesterday. Things didn't start off so well as after we were seated, it took approximately 10 mins for anyone to come to our table. We weren't upset about it we were just like hey, what about us? lol. Luckily for us, the person that happened to check on us just happened to be one of the manager's, who name I did not get. But she greeted us with a wonderful smile and asked if we had been helped. Sadly we said no and she took care of us right away with assigning Phillip to our table and he was fabulous. The first round of drinks was on the manager, which was really sweet. Again we were not upset at all, just wondering what happened. At any rate the strawberry margarita I received was delicious as always. We also ordered the Trio, which was on happy hour and consisted of chips, queso, and salsa. Delicious!!! Of course we had to order their signature cornbread, which was fresh out of the oven upon arrival. It was melt in your mouth delicious and yet so bad for you so you know it is extra good. By the time my yummy street tacos came, I was full from everything else.  Like I said before, Phillip, our waiter was awesome, the food was delicious, and my company was as fabulous as ever. Will I come back to this location? Of course! I chalk it up a slight mishap and a busy evening. Plus in the end, the food and service was great so what more could you ask for?

Always a good time coming here. Great service, great food, and AMAZING HAPPY HOUR! Mon-fri 3-7pm and sat-sun 3-5pm. Margaritas are bomb, my favorite is the fruit infused patron or the chambord. WARNING: they sneak up on you quick!  My favorite appetizers are the Tejas trio, shrimp & guac tostada bites, and street tacos.

My husband and I call Z'tejas "old reliable". When I don't feel like cooking and/or we need to meet for lunch near our house and don't feel like thinking too much, old reliable it is. 
We really enjoy the burgers, the chipotle mayo is tasty and the bread has a hint of sweetness. Unfortunately, there have been times were the bread was stale, not often but enough to remember.
The shrimp tostadas, fish tacos and tortilla soup are very good as well. The Chambord margarita is delicious and I like the pomegranate-ginger 
margarita martini drink, the ginger-sugar rim is very tasty. 
I have eaten at different Z'tejas locations and they are pretty consistent. 
Service is usually good, never had anything worse than waiting a bit longer for food or our bill.

I have frequent Ztejas regularly for years and have kicked off my bday celebration at their Happy Hour the last few years with a party of 10-15 people each year. I have always had a nice experience and a good time. However this past weekend I was celebrating my birthday at Ztejas Happy Hour with 9 of my friends and we were outside on the patio enjoying ourselves ordering drinks and appetizers. We weren't cussing or being vulgar language just laughing talking and having a good time. Again outside on the patio during Happy Hour. Apparently unbeknownst to us  another table felt were we being too loud and moved inside. The manager on duty at that time named Chris came outside and asked us to quiet down. And then had the audacity to say he didn't want to offend us. We all all corporate employees who know how to conduct ourselves in public and we're not in any way being disrespectful to others around us. Not only was I highly offended my bday kickoff was ruined. In a time when our country is dealing with so much racial insensitivity it was very offensive and a very poor decision on the managers part to come and ask a table full of paying patrons that were simply laughing, talking and enjoying themselves to quite down. Due to his lack of consideration for all of the customers he cause one of his waitresses to lose a lot of money that night and regardless we never should of been treated that way. I have no interest in ever visiting this restaurant ever again. Highly disappointed! Never have I ever been treated with such disrespect.

I just spoke with a manager this morning about an interesting experience last night at Z Tejas. The food was good. The queso dip would probably taste better and more authentic if it weren't made with American cheese. The guac was not salted. However, our entrees were good and I cleaned my plate. Love the free cornbread. Our waiter was very charismatic with us and we immediately thought, wow! What a great waiter! We thought that he was very nice and professional, even though our entrees arrived really fast, before our chips and dip (not even a big deal). That is when it seems like things took a turn for the worst. 

Mid conversation, myself and a friend were very suddenly distracted by an extreme screaming match going on right next to us in the kitchen. It was so loud and clear. My first thought was, jeez I hope our waiter isn't being yelled at -- then, after a quick glance, I realized that the person who was yelling was actually our waiter! Our jaws dropped. The restaurant would get quiet as the screaming commenced. The employees nervously paced and darted their eyes around. Whoever was being yelled at in the kitchen seemed to try to defend themselves, but the waiter was so relentless. We sat there eating, talking, and very frequently stopping to listen to the drama. 

I hate that I am leaving this review. However, the manager told me this morning that he would be emailing me. I haven't received that email yet. My friend and I who visited the restaurant work very hard, and it is not easy to just fork over $80 for a couple drinks, dinner and chips with dip... let alone listen to people be berated when we are just trying to chill! I hope to hear from management soon via email like promised. We want to come back because our entrees were fabulous, but last night was just downright unacceptable and unprofessional! We will go to another location if the Ray location is too problematic. Sad times.

Went to grab a quick lunch today and this place was recommended.  There is ample parking and is located in a shopping plaza.  We got there early and there was plenty of parking, when we left, the place was getting their lunch time rush. The inside was nice and open and decorated nicely which made for a pleasant visit.

We were seated immediately and our waiter started out with the drinks.  We let the waiter know that we were in a rush because we had to catch a plane, this is typically a good test of the urgency the waiter can relay back to the kitchen, which they nailed, great teamwork guys..  They serve some corn bread with butter which was warm and fresh and had a little bit of sweetness.  

I ordered the steak burrito which was covered in sauce.  The steak was nice and juicy and they were ample size cuts.  The burrito had a nice little spice to it and came with some rice on the plate. 

The only thing I think needs a little change is the salsa and chips.  None of the three salsa's were particularly spicy and didn't really stand out from one another even though they were different styles.

First time here and it was fantastic! I live about an hour away from the chandler area but we needed to waste time to avoid traffic so we stopped in here for dinner. The atmosphere is casual but the restaurant itself is beautiful! 

I have been dieting so my mom and I split the chicken fajitas with corn tortillas. It was very good. They have a roasted salsa that's delicious and the guacamole was very good. Great portion to share. 

The service was excellent from start to finish! The hostess was very friendly and went over specials and even recommended dishes when we sat down. The server answered all our questions and was very prompt on refills and checking in with us. The manager also ran our food out to us and checked back to make sure everything was great. 

Overall great experience with food and service. Will be back when I'm in town. Thanks!

Started great by getting seating right away, in a booth, on a Friday night. Had an attentive and wonderful waiter. Started with yummy tostada bites, good as always. Didn't care for my chicken tortilla soup, but was filled up with the appetizer, corn bread & beer.

Mass-produced mediocrity. I am not normally so blunt and so negative right at the start of a review, and yet this establishment seems best-described by this three-word opener. Crab cake appetizer was a cold bit of crab blended with a cold mass of filler, heaped on a confused mish-mash of greens, the best parts of which were the pseudo-Remoulade sauce and pumpkin seeds. Navajo taco special consisted of a few shrimp plopped into a mush of rice and cold black beans, all piled atop a cold and greasy slab of Indian fry bread. Hamburger ordered medium-well arrived rare. One good point, our server was very efficient and friendly, which made up in some part for the coldness of the greeter. Will not return.
Beautiful restaurant.  Well decorated.  Customer service is great!   Food is amazing!

We went here for lunch today with the padres as they are in town for a couple weeks.  The place was dead at 1 p.m. on a Wednesday afternoon during some school's spring break.  

We were seated promptly.  Z'Tejas carries the Republic of Tea drinks, so some of us ordered Pomegranite, I ordered the decaf Ginger Peach.  They served us a skillet cornbread (guess that is their specialty "bread basket" )  For lunch I had the cup of soup: Gumbo was on the chef's soup special today.  The broth was thick, the sausage was spicy, the chicken was tender and there was just enough rice to consider it a gumbo.

I also had the Z' salad which was a small mixed leaf lettuce with tomato, green and red bell pepper, parmesean cheese and their own string like crutons.  I got the ginger vinegrette on the side.  It was just enough to fill me up, but not make me unbutton my pants. LOL.

The rest of the group had variations of enchiladas: mushroom, chicken and cheese.  The lunch plate size is very good, and included rice and choice of beans.  I am glad restaurants are finally sizing DOWN the portions!  I am tired of doggy-bags that sit in the fridge only to be tossed out.

If you gave Z any less than 4 stars - you've just never had one of their fab margaritas!  My favorite is the Cha-Mango (chambord and mango mixed).  But let me not get ahead of myself....

I don't live in a city with a Z'Tejas anymore, so I always make sure to stop in when I'm in Phoenix.  Before you go, just note, it's TEX-MEX, not Mexican food.  There is a difference and you have to know what you're getting into.  My favorite dishes are the baked seafood enchiladas and the jerk chicken salad.  They also bring you cornbread (with real corn in it) while you wait for your meal.

Z always goes above and beyond when it comes to customer service, so you never have to worry when you come in - you'll ALWAYS be taken care of!

Met a friend here for lunch.  It was not as packed as I thought it would be.  It was nice, walked in grab a table, and the server immediately stopped by to say hello and ask what I would like to drink.  

The corn bread was SO SO good!!!  I ordered from the specialities section of the menu.  Five cheese macaroni & achiote chicken (made with bleu, Jack, cheddar, parmesan and Romano cheeses, finished with toasted bacon gratin).  It was pretty good.

Awesome food & drinks. Packed Friday night, I can see potential as good place to chill and meet peeps. 

I ended up just ordering bunch of appt and drinks since it was biz dinner, turned out perfect with portion of the food. 

It's tad noisy for biz lunch / dinner, but service was excellent and will come back again.
Been there numerous times, but never ordered steak until this last Sunday. I ordered what I thought was steak but received a piece of fat! Thankfully they did not charge it, it was a $29 plate.

I order to go fairly often from here. My daughter and I love the nachos. I usually order to go. We ordered the nachos, street tacos, and corn bread. I didn't ask them to separate the nachos so they were soggy by the time we got home. The street tacos weren't impressive. The corn bread was good as always. 

I'm not the best at checking my receipts when I get them as was the case this weekend. Today I came across the Z'Tejas receipt in my purse and started reading through it. I noticed there's a To-Go Service Charge and a To-Go Service Charge Tax!! I may be behind on the times but since when do you get charged to take food home? So do I get charged the same fee if I eat and the restaurant and take food home? It could be that I've been charged this before but didn't check the receipt. The mom and pop restaurants I frequent don't charge these fees. I won't be a regular customer of Z'Tejas any longer if I'm charged to order to go. I'm sure I can find some delicious nachos elsewhere.

The cornbread and service were decent/tolerable. The food was also okay. The voodoo tuna was good but not worth spending 22 dollars on I would rather spend 8 more dollars and get quality fish and a lot bigger cut then what little they give you here. I wish I would have ordered fajitas or burger or even the fish tacos so I would feel like my mom got her money's worth. Definitely will not come back most likely unless I have no choice in the matter. My sister was supposed to have spicy pasta and it wasn't even remotely spicy. My mom got jambalaya thinking that it would come with rice like at yard house and she hates pasta mind you, so when they brought pasta she didn't want to be one of those annoying customers that sends stuff back so she basically was picking at her seafood off of the dish the whole time.  My brother got the Mac and cheese he seemed to like it but it seemed like 3/5 ppl didn't enjoy their food enough to want to come back.

Went there twice this week for Happy Hour. Once to the Chandler location and once to the Scottsdale Mall location. I've eaten at both locations a few times over the past year as well.

Food: Very good. Always good flavor with being gratuitously spicy. Mushroom enchiladas are my favorite meal. I've tasted EVERY appetizer and they are all very satisfying. Good portion size for an app, which makes the happy hour prices all the more attractive! 

Drinks: Happy Hour Drink prices are quite high compared to other HH's. Otherwise, I guess they're pretty much in line. The Chambourd Frozen Margarita is delish!

Service: Never had a bad experience with the wait staff. Friendly, attentive, and knowledgable. Seem to be perfectly okay with their tables ordering off the HH menu (some servers don't like the small tabs and it's reflected in their performance). Like I said, not a problem here (IME).

So this place always was one of our favorites and will continue to be until something changes.

Went here for brunch and waited 40 mins for my food. They did not offer water. They gave me beef when I ordered chicken. Did not even apologize or offer to comp anything. Food really sucked. No flavor. After taking our order we did not see waiter again until he wanted the bill paid. 0/10 do not recommend to anyone under any circumstances ever.

I love this joint .. got nothing bad to say at all!  All of the wait staff are good but there a few that provide such GREAT service that you will be blown away.  AND get this, if you go a few times, some will recognize you and come to the table to see how you've been doing, even if you aren't at one of their tables.  Top that off with a creative menu and excellent execution and you've got one great date night!  I can't recommend this spot enough!

Food was excellent, environment very nice.  Music alittle loud, however.  Our waiter was rather rude to begin with, but seemed to regret it quickly and behaved himself for the rest of our meal.  I can recommend this place.  I was going to give them only 3 and a half stars, but my wife talked me into 4.
Love this place. Got seated quickly by very friendly staff. The food was amazing. Had the wild mushroom enchiladas. Would definitely go back.

I have been to Z Tejas several times and never had a problem. But this time... First off, we go to the hostess, ask for a table for two, and they say it'll be a 20 minute wait and they'll text us when the table is ready. Cool, no problem. We walk around Casa Paloma for a while and then 25 minutes pass without hearing anything. We head back to Z Tejas only to see a large party in front us walking in and immediately being seated. We ask the hostess when we could expect to be seated and lo and behold they find a table for us right away. Once we sit down, I look at the menu and see that the cornbread, which has always been free in the past, now costs $3. Not a big deal but still a bit chintzy in my opinion. We ask the waiter when the change happened and he says "December 1st. Were you guys planning on just snacking on cornbread and hanging out?" The rudeness of this statement and the implication that accompanies it stuns me. Believe it or not, just because I'm younger doesn't mean I don't plan on spending money for a decent dinner. So at this point we walk out and I make sure to tell the hostess why we were leaving and ask her to pass the message along to the manager. I will never come back and I will be sure to tell my friends and family not to either.

MY favorite Z's by far! The one on mill is decent but the bloody mary bar here on the weekends is much larger! My service is always amazing and cannot help but ask for the same server every sunday, I cannot believe I have forgotten his name but he is great! 
The bloody nary bar is full of different tomato juices and things to put in it, and if they run out of anything they are quick to jump and get you more. The cornbread and peach muffin are my favorite, I dont even like muffins but i always ask for an extra! I also love the jalepeno bacon and always get a side of that also, SOOOO GOOD!!
I have yet to come during any hour but breakfast but I must try because it is delic!
Man can these guys cook some bomb shrimp! Drinks are great too.  Nothing is bad here.

Baked Seafood enchiladas were good. Queso appetizer great! Nice ambience and decor. Service slow and short of attention. Had to wait for anyone to come to table. Still waiting for containers and check and its been 15 minutes. Better service would have gotten them more stars because the menu is fun. Not likely to return.

Had a buisness dinner here last night. I was impressed the food selection was good. Good appetizers and good service. The setup inside was good. I need to come back and try the happy hour specials. I had the seafood enchilada which was good. I WILL BE BACK!

This location has gone from very good to just OK to terrible in the past months. Tonight was the end of our patronage to this Z'Tejas and probably all the others in the chain. We were 30 minutes into our wait when the manager approached 3 parties in the waiting area and advised that we could not plan to eat there as the 'kitchen was backed up'. There were empty tables when we arrived. Management at this location has hit rock bottom.  Obviously they have staffing issues. And the Sunday Brunch has not been worth the money since last Easter when they modified the menu.  They don't deserve the one star but it is the Yelp minimum.  Do yourself a favor, stay away!  We will for sure.

Z'Tejas never disappoints! Make sure to make reservations as it's delicious and fills up quickly!

Happy hour was pretty decent, 5 dollar drinks and apps ranging from 6 to 8. We always get the Tejas trio-chips and salsa, guacamole, and queso. Love that every meal also comes with fresh cornbread that you can take home. This is something we haven't had at any other restaurants, and it makes th dinner unique! I always get either the diablo pasta (delicious) but tried the Baja tacos this time. I had a couple of requests and the kitchen was very accommodating. My fiancé switches between burgers and fajitas and is always happy with his meal.

Our server was fantastic. Made great recommendations and was efficient with getting everything to us. I'd reccamend this place to anyone!
The Diablo chicken was amazing. I got mine without the jalapeños and it still had a bit of a zesty kick.

Don't eat or drink anything at this place! Came here after golf today with friends and ordered a happy hour margarita, it was mostly ice. Will never come here again and will tell all my friends to avoid this restaurant.

I was craving Guacamole, as usual. We decided to try Z'Tejas since they make the table side Guac. 

Service was Extremely SLOW. 

By The Way, I think they should serve complimentary chips and salsa instead of the complimentary cornbread. 

Any how, I ordered the Guac and the Chips and Salsa. The 3 salsas were, House salsa (tasted like spaghetti sauce, too sweet, yuck) Verde with avocado and tomatillo ( good but really bland, I had to add salt) and Fire roasted ( most decent of the three but still on the sweet side and I had to add salt.) 

The Guacamole was the most disappointing of all though. I did order it with out cheese and onions but that shouldn't have made a difference. It was completely lack luster and flavorless. No Lime juice or seasonings were added to it at all, except Salt, by me.  And I rarely salt anything.

The husband did enjoy his breakfast enchiladas. 

The only reason they are getting 3 stars is because I do appreciate them having a small V/GF/VEG menu. Other than that, I wasn't impressed.

Probably one of the better places to take a date, not to secluded, a busy restaurant yet you can carry on a conversation.  My pork arrived a bit raw so I did send it back, and I was hoping to get some kind of discount for it, but I've had way to many meals at this place so I can overlook it.  A bit pricey, but you can't find the type of food they make any where else.  I wish they had the Chilean Sea Bass all the time but it's seasonal, the most unbelievable piece of fish I've had.

The chile pork verde and the jerk chicken salad were delish.....and holy hell, the chambord margaritas. Amazing and potent but if you've had little sleep and no food, take it easy on these....especially early in the day. I had two and was shitaaaaay. o_o

I haven't been here in a while but yelp wasn't around when I came here. It was my birthday and I ordered the steak and it was marinated to perfection. My father brings home food from here sometimes and it is always good. Try it out, it's Tex-mex!

I will NEVER go to this specific restaurant again.  I have been to this location for dinner about 5-6 times.  The last time I was there, the service was horrible.  We waited 15 minutes for someone to come by and TAKE our drink order.  Then we wait 40 minutes to cash out. 

DON'T GO HERE.  

Go to the one on Mill Ave instead.

We eat at this location every time we get to the Phoenix area. We have never been disappointed with our food, our server, or our time spent here.
My only complaint would be that there is no ZTejas in Fort Worth where I live.

My boyfriend and I had a long day at work and wanted to get some drinks and split entrees! Z'Tejas more than delivered! Trevor, our waiter, was absolutely amazing! He gave us exemplary customer service with his energy, passion and knowledge of the food and drinks! The atmosphere was lovely for a late romantic dinner with dimmed lights and a low-volume sophisticated demeanor. The food was fantastic! We started with chips and salsa, then a bowl of tortilla soup and then the baked seafood enchilada which Trevor happily recommended! It was so yummy. You have to try the baked seafood enchilada! They even split it on two plates for us and we were very pleasantly surprised!I had the chambord margarita with a sugar rim and it was phenomenal--good amount of alcohol! My boyfriend had the Z Tejas mule, and he's pretty picky about mules--he loved it!  Great service, great food, great drinks and good prices! We'll be back soon!!!
They got rid of the Bloody Mary bar. They're dead to me. Although, their jalapeño pancakes are... interesting.

I LOVE this place.  Great food at great prices with great service in a great atmosphere.  Great variety, great spices, great presentation, great menu.  Every entree gets a cornbread dish skillet to nibble on.  I think I would love everything on the menu.  Can't wait to go back and try them all.  Love It!!

Two words: Chambord Margarita

I used to not even like margarita's, Z Tejas changed my outlook on tequila.  

The food is great too.  My usual favorites are the shrimp & guac tostada bites to start then move on to the artichoke chicken stack for dinner, and cornbread of course.  I've also tried the smoked chicken enchiladas and loved em.  Sunday morning brunch I have to have my egg hash...and a margarita :)

It had been a while since I've eaten at Z'Tejas.  Decided to meet up with a friend and have a good Margarita and a bite or two.   Overall it was an excellent experience.

Service
-Amazing from being greeted at the door to our amazing server Missy.  She is amazing at what she does.  So amazing that I am writting this review a month later after finding my receipt.  She had amazing recommendations and I ran with them, every item she recommended what amazing.  It obvious she's knowledgeable about the menu and knows how to ask the right questions to provide the perfect recommendation.  One of the best experiences I have had with a server and I eat out tons.

Food
-Seasoned well, perfect amount of spice to it.
-Looked good and came out hot instead of looking like it had been under a heat lamp and coming out with the "I've been sitting under a heat lamp look"  
My Marg was on point! 

Atmosphere
-Busy, a bit loud but not unbearable.  It was what was to be expected during Happy Hour.
-Clean, tables being bused in a timely manner
-Clean Restrooms.

Overall I will make sure not to wait so long to come visit again.  I hope to have the pleasure of being served by Missy again as well.
Love the service! And the food is amazing, everything looks fresh and very well presented! And the plates can be shared!

Great service! They serve cornbread instead of chips as an appetizer. It's yummy. The food is spicy and full of flavor. I was very impressed. And the dim lighting and decor make it a great place to take your date :)

Tonight Z'Tejas let me down. It is unfortunate because I love the food here. I booked a party for six for a reservation at 7:30pm. We were seated right away in the upper level of the restaurant. Our waitress came over right away and took our drink orders. It all started out pretty well.

One of the members of our party had never been here before so he wanted to order three appetizers for us to all share. I recommended the Tejas Trio (queso, salsa and guacamole) and he told our waitress to pick two of her other favorites. Now I understand that he did leave this up to her discretion however, she chose two other items with shrimp and seafood in them. As a waitress I would have maybe considered that not everyone in the party would have liked seafood. I would have understood maybe one other appetizer with seafood but not both. Again, it was left to her discretion so I cannot say too much about this one.

I tried to get her attention two different times to order a margarita, both times she swiftly walked away, maybe I needed to be louder. All things I could have shook off if our meal would have been up to par as it usually is. I had recommended to the other members of our party to order the 21 day aged filet. We had previously had an amazing experience with this steak. Three of us decided to order this item. When they came out they were all New York strip and not filet. Not really that big of deal but when you are a expecting one cut of steak and you receive a different one, it is a little disappointing. My steak was supposed to be a filet topped with a peppercorn crust and topped with a mushroom sauce. It came out as a New York strip, topped with the peppercorn crust but no sauce whatsoever. My dining companions decided to keep the New York strips in lieu of returning them to re-fire filets. I decided to have a filet re-fired because my steak came out completely wrong. I reordered the new steak with the Gorgonzola butter instead of the peppercorn crust because it looked dry when it was brought out.

After waiting fifteen minutes, after all of my dining companions were finished eating, I received my new steak. It was a filet after all but it still came out with the peppercorn crust instead of the Gorgonzola butter. I just feel as though the entire night our waitress did not listen to anything we said. I really am not that picky but after getting all three of our steaks wrong, and getting mine wrong twice I was irritated. This was the place that my fiancé and I had recommended to out of town guests and I feel as though it was a big let down tonight. I just do not think our waitress could handle a big party along with serving her other tables.

I still might be back because I know how good the food can be here. I just think we came on an off night. Too bad.

I had to give this place three stars as an average of two and four from the two times I have eaten here. 
The first time service and food were beautiful. Actually, both times service has been top-notch. Never a problem with service. 
I again had the seafood enchiladas which are stuffed with tuna, salmon, spinach, and shrimp. This is really a delicious dish and full of flavor but the second time I had it, every other bite was cold (one hot, one cold, one hot, one cold) - weird. Also, some of the people I was with ordered steaks medium rare. Both came out well. Disappointing. 
They do have this different version of a mojito made with pineapple-flavored rum and mint leaves, with brown sugar. It tastes like candy.

I had the worst service with management at this establishment. I have come here for years with my family.  It was with much disappointment to find hair baked into our cornbread.  Instead of being embarrassed this manager was actually brash, cruel, and combative. Never visit this location! I will tell everyone about the experience I had here.

Z Tejas has been consistently good for me. My favorite dishes are the shrimp tostada bites and catfish tacos. This place is definitely one of the better chains out there. Good margaritas too! Half off all apps during happy hour too, so go there.

I was very impressed by the service we received.  Our server was attentive and made sure our drinks were always full.  We enjoyed the Tejas Trio...the cheese dip was my personal favorite.  The green chile barbacoa enchiladas were great.  They had lots of shredded beef and a perfect amount of sauce.  Next time I have to try the mac & cheese!

12/17/15 food was fine - today the service not so good! Will I be back yes so far food has been okay. Seems here the service has been a hit or miss. Was some busy but not slammed. Well maybe it was my fault the on tap beer selection is boring. Manager walked by and says hi, not how was everything and would have shared with her, my lunch order had been delivered before I got chips and salsa which I had to ask for. Oh well! Oh she was at the hostess stand when I entered - wasn't the friendliest greet, matter fact I was an interruption, she glanced around to find her hostesses, she didn't even stop what she was doing to help a newly arrived guest.
I've eaten at ztejas a ton of times and this was my worst visit. 45 minutes to get our food. Manager never even came by!

I would like to thank Z for destroying my anniversary celebration. My wife has many many food allergies. So we don't go out too often. But when we do Z was one of our go to places. They used to have a gluten free menu. But they changed to a menu where they at least put a symbol by plates that were. They even once invented a dessert just so my wife could enjoy too. I was always impressed and that's why we came here.

First they sit us butted up against the service line. It was so loud I could not even hear my wife. Then I noticed a disturbing trend. The wait staff used right behind my head as a good place to hold meeting. Those meeting dealt with complaining, a LOT. Throw in some F-bombs and other language fit for a Waffle House and I was starting to get annoyed.

Then we notice, huh there are no markings on the menu for gluten free anymore. Well our waitress was BRAND NEW. I could see her shaking. She was sweet but the vibe of fear was coming through. My wife asked if she could ask what was up. Out comes a lady who said she was there 14 years. She tells us they just changed the menu MONDAY and this was the first time anyone noticed they forgot to mark things for gluten free. Now I am not sure how you miss this or if you are telling me this just to make it look like an over site? Are they going to REPRINT all the menus?

So we ask about fajitas for my wife, USUALLY they are a safe thing and she gets some meat and ton of vegetables. She eats very healthy and simply and understands she might not get the fanciest dishes. The lady comes back after a good wait and says the chef does not know what is in the marinade. THE CHEF DOES NOT KNOW WHAT IS IN THE FOOD. So now I am done. I think they have finally just decided to go the Chilis route. Order frozen stuff, heat it up and pass it off as home made. Well I am sorry, I am ok with that if I am paying 10.99 a plate. But that is NOT Z Tejas. We got up and left and more than likely won't be back.

So if you USED to go to this place because of your food allergies I would think again. I am saddened because we have lost a good place. They used to be so darn nice and accommodating to my wife. I have been known to leave 25% tips here because they always took that extra step to help my wife and I really appreciated it. I have an idea this is what we will see more of because it is hard paying your staff the new minimum wage and not raise the prices. Just wished we would have known before they ruined my anniversary.

You have to get the Red Chile & Mango Steak salad here! It is so delicious and the best part is the salad is huge and I always have leftovers for the next day. It is definitely spicy so only get it if you like a nice kick. Also I recommend coming here for Easter Brunch! My family has been going for years now and they have there bloody mary/mimosa bar and it's a great price or if you really want to get a buzz get the Chambord margarita. It's frozen and you can't have more than 4 because it's that strong haha I highly recommend
Not bad, but not great either. Nice folks, but the food is just "sort of" Mexican and expensive compared to Las Vegas, where I live.
Came here for happy hour which is M-F 3-7 and weekend 2-6pm. Keagan the bartender is wonderful and attentive. Street tacos are great meat and the green Chile is tasty. Hooray for margaritas!!!!

Yummmmm!
Stopped by here late after a long day. 
Service was fast, food was great, prices were excellent.
The chili con queso appetizer was good, and the fajitas are amazing. My husband had a simple chicken quesadilla which was also really good.
All in all, two appetizers plus drinks and fajitas we spent about $50 including the tip. Will definitely be returning.
Highly recommend!

My all time favorite southwestern Mexican place. Their complimentary corn bread is yummy. I can eat that all day. The dish you have to try it out is baked sea food plate. OMG it is made to perfection. Every bite of it is enjoyable . They happy hour menu is also very exciting with $5 margaritas . Love the interiors and the food here !

Trekked here for lunch one day with some work folk. It left an eh in my mind. Not a bad eh, which is usually a 2 for me, but more like an I'll-come-back-here-if-someone-else-is-dying-to eh, which leaves it at a 3.

I can say that the cornbread is exquisite. It's what cornbread should be. Corn and bread. It's not cornmeal trying to be cornbread. It's not some yuppie metropolitan height of sophistication's chef trying to be country. It's the no shit real deal. I appreciate that. I just have to remember to appreciate it in small quantities.

The service was pretty on par for it being lunch on a Monday. 

My main dish was the seafood enchilada which was pretty on point, but not as good as the one at Blue Adobe. I was pretty annoyed to see it came with tomato even though tomato was listed nowhere on the menu. I will remember that. I may just return and order cornbread with a side of cornbread.

WIfe finally dragged me kicking and screaming to a Mexican restaurant!  She tried the local Four Peaks Kiltlifter and we both liked it.  WE also wanted try the much lauded Chambord margarita, and since we were there for happy hour they brought us two each!  TOmunch on during the cocktails we had the Texas trio and chips, which was salsa, quest and guacamole.  I chose the catfish for my entree, and my wife went for the Achiote chicken chopped salad, with iceberg lettuce, avocado, black beans, Cotija cheese, bacon, roasted curbs, pepitas, Roma tomatoes, red cabbage and ranch vinagrette.  Great place!
THEY FREEZE THE TEQUILA!  margaritas a great, and they have yummy snacks.  good for happy hour.

I was in the mood for something I don't always get for my lunch break last week so I decided to go to Z'Tejas.  I'd been to their other locations but never this one surprisingly.  The hosts at the front were very friendly, the one who walked me to my table actually stayed and made conversation for a couple minutes which hardly ever happens anymore.  My actual server was very friendly too.

I was very happy to see that they had a Build Your Own bar where you could pick from a Bloody Mary, Mimosa, Screwdriver and one other drink I can't remember and it was incredibly cheap!  Only $4 for my Bloody Mary!  They had a wide variety of choices too as far as juices, fruits, vegetables, seasonings, sauces, it was hard to decide!

For my actual entree I ordered the Hickory Burger which has barbecue sauce, chopped onions, bacon, jalapeno mayonnaise and a couple different cheeses.  It was delicious!  Kind of a mess to eat but worth every splatter you get on your face and shirt.  I just wouldn't recommend ordering it if you're with someone you're trying to look dignified in front of... The fries were great too.  Nice and crispy on the outside but soft on the inside.  I was definitely happy with my decision to switch up my lunchtime location and I will for sure be coming back in the future.

Went here for some happy hour margaritas and chips + guac. The margarita was okay, but I didn't taste much tequila in it. And it was pretty small...maybe I just like to drink...

The tableside guacamole is cute idea, albeit a little awkward. The texture was nice and chunky but there was something missing in the spices...cumin, perhaps?

I really liked that they had a vegetarian menu with decent-looking options on it. Not many chain restaurants in Arizona go out of their way to do that!

Overall, it was alright...nothing too special and still a chain restaurant.

Stopped in on a Friday before happy hour ended. On the way in a couple  leaving was saying how upset they were about the service. We were seated and the waiter didnt even greet us just asked what we want to drink. seemed annoyed that we wanted to hurry and order before 7. Their prices are outrageous. $12.00 for a tiny quesadilla regular price. I would only go for happy hour. The drinks are on point!

Ya I just want to say I love this place!! How could you not? The found is outstanding every time I come in I know I will not be disappointed . Idk maybe it's the margaritas talking  but this place is a must try make sure to start out with the dumplings. The flavors in this dish alone gives them the four . It would be a five no doubt but it is always very loud and the service is a hit or miss. But to a foodie like myself the ambience doesn't  really ruin everything So enjoy over eating over drinking and your left overs in the morning! ( they have awesome portion sizes)

The cornbread that they're so proud of is a bland version of jiffy corn muffin mix worst I've ever had. The five cheese Mac-n-cheese has no flavor they just melted some cheese over boiled noodles. The service was slow, the server seemed annoyed that he had to wait on me. I will not be going back.

I have only been here twice but I have not yet been disappointed. The food has been delicious and fresh every time and the drinks are always great! They don't skimp on the alcohol either. You must try the street tacos, the catfish beignets, and the Chombard Margarita. All excellent choices. The staff has been great both times as well. Attentive but not annoyingly so. I'll be back again for sure!

Very good atmosphere. 
Tried couple of appetizers: shrimp-avocado tostado bites and the triple option (queso, ): both pretty good
The warm corn bread they served before our order was just awesome. 
However I was disappointed with their chicken fajitas: not sizzling and the chicken wasn't succulent. 
My colleagues liked their shrimp pasta.

My husband and I love dining here as they have quick, professional service and the food is always pleasing to the tastebuds. My favorite item on the menu is the wedge salad with skirt steak topped with blue cheese dressing. It's bound to have your tastebuds go wow!

Keep in mind folks, its not supposed to be authentic Mexican food. 5 stars for the all around good experience. We were seated promptly, service was fast and friendly (we made it for the last 15 minutes of happy hour!) Ordered pork nachos, Chambord margarita, duck relleno, and Mac and cheese. All the food was tasty, and the margarita was strong! Love the cornbread too. Have to warn you, the food is very HEAVY, delicious, but heavy. Reasonably priced, great service. I will return.

Co-worker brought me here for dinner on my last night in Tempe.  A Wednesday night and it was still busy, most likely because of their happy hour.  One small gripe is that their beer selection could use improvement.  They did have a couple Four Peaks available (good IPA), but they could stand to have a couple more local or micro options.  We skipped appetizers, and went straight to an entree with the exception of chips and salsa.  The chips were fresh and the salsa was above average.  I had the Santa Fe Smoked Chicken Enchilada with beans and rice.  The enchilada was really good, with the sauce having a good amount of spice.  The cornbread that was included with the meal was worth mentioning as well.  Overall a good meal and I would return when back in the area.

Great food as usual. I brought my parents here for the first time. They really liked it. My only complaint was the noise level. Wow! Right next to the bar screaming across the table to each other or the server. My hard of hearing dad just tuned out because he heard nothing but bar laughter and chatter. Next time a table far from the bar....

I was NOT impressed at all. I was really excited about trying this place because a friend was raving about it. 

My friends ordered two micheladas, the guy asked "do you want the beer mixed with the clamato juice? with lime? with a seasoning on the rim?" we answered "Yes!" When the drinks came, it was just a glass of beer and a side of clamato juice for two beers. We were not aware that they had to share the juice. I asked for a cheeseburger well done, no bacon and it was medium well with bacon. I know I probably won't get sick if I eat pink meat, but that was not what I ordered. One thing my friend did like was the jalapeño mayonnaise. 

I have to say this place is over priced and not worth my drive. I can get better food and service in Tucson at Sir Vesas.

I don't think I get the Z Tejas paradigm.  I've gone here twice for work lunches on other people's dimes, and I can honestly say that the food doesn't make sense to me.  It's like they've taken great Mexican food dishes and then tried to yuppify them so they appear to be hip, trendy, and healthy.  They fail on all three counts and destroy the flavor in the process.

This particular restaurant completely forgot about one person's food and he had to eat awkwardly after everyone else was already done.  They comped his meal, but since he wasn't paying for it anyway, it was no consolation to him.

No me gusta!

Went there today for the Sunday Brunch. So good!!!! I have food allergies and the manager, Jennifer was so helpful in making sure that I received the correct plate. I am in the restaurant industry and it was wonderful to see how much she cares about her guests!!! We will definitely be back again, and again!!! Great food, drinks, atmosphere and service!!!

I can't say nothing but great things about Z'Tejas. My husband and I eat here at least once-twice a week. I usually get the avocado chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries (YUM!!!!) and my husband gets the chopped chicken salad or the steak burrito. The restaurant is always packed, but the servers do a great job and are always attentive. 

If you're looking for a great happy hour, they have the best around, hands down. Nothing beats their chambord margarita and tejas trio. The best part is that they have happy hour on the weekends all afternoon!

If you've never been, you have to try it!

I really wish I had had a better experience at this restaurant. We've gone probably 5 times in the last year and each time it's been progressively worse. I second the reviewer who mentioned how loud it was inside...I mean, music blaring - I couldn't hear myself think - loud. I actually politely asked the front person if they could turn it down just a notch and they looked at me like I was crazy. To make matters worse, our service was SO slow. We had gotten there around 11:00 a.m. for brunch and waited more than 30 minutes for our food, and the restaurant wasn't even busy. Each time we've gone there, it's been the same experience, so we've given up on this one. Bummer.
Thought the steaks were incredible and we weren't really expecting them to be.  Overall atmosphere was lively and fun.  Bar could be bigger, but still overall a very nice place and recommend.
The food had no flavor! Tortilla soup tastes like baby food. Don't waste your money or time.

This place is great for anyone who's single the bar area stays packed. If your going here to eat with a friend or family member you may get a bit irritated. The noise level of this place is ridiculous (it maybe the super high ceiling and seating in an open area) you would have to sit close or yell out your convo to one another. The food is average I find myself asking for extra sauce and the menu changes so much you can really keep a favorite unless you eat here every other day. My waitress Maria was a sweet heart. Her customer service made my experience at lot better.

I absolutely adore this restaurant!!! The margaritas are amazing!!! My husband and I go there for happy hour once a week!!! The macaroni is Dee-lish!!!! I highly recommend this establishment with its great food and even better drinks!!!!

Z Tejas has been and always will be one of my favorites here in the valley.  First, the good is great quality and great value.  You can get a great meal for $15.  I know people knock it because it's a "smaller" chain....but don't kid yourself, some of the mom & pop shops in town are just terrible.  Second, Z has great service.  It's one of the best run resturants I've been to and I eat out a lot.

Overall, you can't go wrong with this pick for yourself or for guest.

Service was unreal bad, bartender smelled like an ashtray to begin with.
Was served cold soup with no flavor, he took our order without writing a thing down which was a mistake.
My burger was medium well, asked for medium rare and pretty tasteless.

I don't see the hype and won't be back, yuck

Outstanding customer service from Matthew & from Jenn the world's best general mgr.  Food was on time and hot. Always checking on us to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. 
Tom & Diane

Came here today on 02/8/17. Ordered shrimp amd guac tostada bites and blackened cat fish taco appetizers which were delicious. For our entree we ordered the salmon salad and a seafood enchilda and everything was sooo delicious. The food is amazing, the service and atmosphere were both A+. Had a great experience. Will def be back. Also, chambord margarita and the bloody mary were great as well.

Consistently great food. Service has been good too for the most part. Once when we went for lunch they accommodated us as best they could when it came to items we wanted from the dinner menu without us even making a fuss. That's the only thing I dislike about the restaurant. .. the seperate menus. I get why they do it though and just make sure to go after 3 if I want the dinner menu.

We had a Company Christmas Party here on a Friday night back in December.  Even with the place being packed, the service was awesome and the timing of the food was exactly as we had requested.  Everyone had a great time and loved the food.  I highly recommend booking a party here.

Z'Tejas has great margaritas (DUH), a great wine list and great food.  The atmosphere is awesome and I have never had an issue with service whether dining in the bar or in the dining room.  They are even nice enough to customize my margarita with jalapenos when I go there.  You'd think it wouldn't be that hard for a Mexican/Margarita joint but I have a hard time getting that request fulfilled at several places around PHX.

Bottom line, this is a great place for a date, a friendly get together or even lunch!!  The food will get you in the door and the cocktails and ambiance will get you coming back.

I came here once for happy hour, sat at the bar. I ordered the tacos and they were so delicious & packed with flavor. The bartender was very kind & the drinks were so good and pretty strong. I would definitely come back again. I also love the location, I had happy hour & then went and saw a movie.

With the interesting ingredients and combinations listed on the menu, we had expected to be dazzled by the flavors.  Unfortunately, the flavors were very bland and the only dominant one was chipotle.  Chipotle is overdone and overrated in our opinion.  Really expected some unique delicious food and were disappointed.

I find this place okay... it gives consistently a-okay food, but nothing great.  The prices are good and the drinks are good.  I find the food a bit heavy.   The salsas tend to be too sweet for my taste and no where nearly spicy enough.  It's a good alternative to other big-box chain.

This restaurant is my go-to whenever I'm in town.  Their menu is pretty amazing and always has a great selection of interesting, unique southwestern food.  

My staples: the fish tacos, the catfish beignets, and now the Achiote Chicken chopped salad!  The tacos and beignets are always delish, but this salad is seriously scrumptious.  It has corn, avacado, and pumpkin seeds in it--which sounds like a weird combo, but it's great!  

Today, I also tried the southwester chicken soup.  So good-chunks of avocado with grilled chicken and tortilla chips.  The cornbread is always great too-definite comfort food.  

You can usually get a table pretty quickly there and their staff is always super friendly.

Service was best part of our meal experience. Pork tenderloin was over cooked, mixed veggies were flavorless, trout was dry and overcooked as was the salmon. Very disappointed as I know they can do better.

I didn't know Z'Tejas had multiple locations until this past weekend.  I had been to the one in Tempe ages ago, and an associate swore by the one at Tatum.  We happened to meet up at the Chandler location.

Everyone obsesses about the cornbread, but I don't love cornbread.  That's okay because the dip trio is amazing - guacamole, queso, and salsa.  The chicken enchiladas are very popular here, and it is probably because the chicken is smoked/roasted beforehand, so it has a nice flavor.

I ordered a salmon salad, and I loved it.  I normally don't like mixed greens, but I highly recommend it.  It was abnormally spicy for a spicy salad though.

It's so interesting because I feel like Z'Tejas is almost like a Valley version of Cafe Poca Cosa (Tucson); it has the same kind of vibe without all the hype.  Sort of a ritzy Southwestern take on Mexican food.  I am a fan, but the service was abnormally slow and confused when I went there.

Z'Tejas = awesome margaritas, delicious salsa and guacamole, ruby trout salad, and not to mention the often overlooked and missed bananas foster french toast of the weekend brunch. They also have many delicious other entrees, some of which I have sampled, but I must say I stick with the favorite standbys. Also a great place for a happy hour bite. Try the Millionaire margarita on the rocks!

As PF Chang's is to oriental cuisine, Z'Tejas is to Southwestern.  Same idea.

I didn't say it was a good idea.  It's ok, not great.

PF Chang's pulls this trick off wonderfully.  Z'Tejas, not so much.

We went for lunch and were seated immediately.  The place we had originally planned on going had a line out the door.  

This is a huge restaurant and beautifully appointed.  Servers were all nice and did a good job.

It's a little dark in here.  It was lunch and had numerous windows but unfortunately we were not seated near them. I had trouble reading the menu.

The corn bread and butter starter is a nice touch.  Everyone likes a freebie.  It just wasn't that tasty.  Nothing special.

I went with a dish off their "seasonal" menu and it did not disappoint.  That being said, it wasn't overly special either.  The beans and rice were okay also but again, nothing special.

The bill came quickly and we were out the door in less than 45 minutes.  Very efficient.

Not the best southwestern food I've had but it's decent.  Don't expect much.

I ordered off of UberEATS and the food was extremely bland - which was rather surprising. The only flavoring that came through on the steak tacos was the raw onion. The steak itself was gray and sad. Also, the dish said it comes with Southwestern rice and black beans - nope, they lied. Just four tacos, for $16.60. $4.15 a taco. I wish I knew, you can get much better street tacos for $1.50 each right down the street from me. I thought I'd give Z'Tejas a try though, and what a let down. Additionally the corn bread is mediocre - tastes like corn bread you'd get premade from a local grocery store that's been under a heat lamp since the morning.

My boyfriend got the Green Chile Barbacoa enchiladas. In his words, "I feel like I'm eating a TV dinner." All of the food was disappointing, and now I know that I won't be paying a visit in person or order from them again.

Holy Chambord Margarita! Where have you been all my life???

My first time, we did happy hour. Service was slow, but the food and drink made up for it. We ordered three appetizers and two rounds of the delish chambord margaritas. I am not usually one for frozen drinks, but this was wonderful - like frozen raspberry lemonade with a great kick!

My second time, I went with a big group of kids and adults for lunch. Everything we ordered was perfect and delish and the service was great.

The third time, I went just for the chambord margerita on a friday night with my husband around 10pm. It was standing room only - packed - all the pre-clubbers were getting their drink on. 

I have been another handful of times just for the Chambord Margerita. The food is great, but the prices are a bit high for what you get. I will still frequent.

Get the Chicken Chop Salad!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Phew, now that I got that important information out there... I can tell you that it was a delightful lunch.  Our waitress was spot on and really fun.  We also ordered the Nacho Trio app and the cheese was sooo gooey, spicy and delicious!  And then there is the cornbread... that was too good to pass up too! And since we were having mexican, we had their $6 margaritas and well, it was a great girl's lunch!

My coworkers and I frequent this place for lunch a lot as we always enjoy the atmosphere the food and the complimentary cornbread.  Unfortunately I'm mixed on the new direction they've chosen to go as the cornbread is no longer 'complimentary'. 

It's now $3 and the complimentary item during this time is chips and salsa! I gotta admit, they are good (salty) but the main drawl was that, cornbread!! The $3 goes to the community which is cool, but not a fan as I don't know how much really goes to them, etc.... I 'm not going to lie I don't like having that pushed on me, maybe as an option yes. 

It would be like Red Lobster telling me if you want cheddar Bay biscuits now you got to pay a dollar for everyone u eat... Or even Red Robin saying no more bottomless fries, or no beverage refills... I could go on. Probably will return, but not for lunch. Would liked to see it again as an option donation for a specialty drink, a new dinner menu item, a desert, etc...

Excellent service, first & foremost. Kudos to manager & staff. Menu is terrific. Grilled seafood enchilada was outstanding. (I'm a bit tired an in hurry, so would have otherwise had more here!) look forward to returning, for sure. Very very good value!!
Always good! Like most of the other Yelpers...Cornbread is Crazy Yummy, Margaritas are Tasty & Potent! Everything here is consistent, service, food, and drinks.
Banana fosters and the enchiladas were tasty :) service could have been a little quicker. Great atmosphere though.
Terrible food. Were the steak tacos supposed to be purely made of steak fat? To top it off, got charged for a beer that I took two sips of and sent back. Will not be going back.

I visited Z'Tejas years ago while I was in college.  A friend and I were searching for nachos and decided to try Z'Tejas for happy hour.  I was super disappointed.  The green chili pork nachos were decent with the meat being the best part.  The street tacos and shrimp tostada bites were meh.  The best part was probably the complimentary corn bread.
Appetizers aren't good!! And waaaay to pricey! The drinks are wonderful though. A good overall happy hour spot.

Typical chain "southwestern/Tex Mex" food in a corporatey atmosphere. They have some tasty dishes and a killer sunday brunch, but everything on the menu is kind of ambiguous.

Prices here are about on par with most places of this type (I put it in the Applebee's, TGI Friday's, Charleston's, etc.) category. 

I enjoyed my visit to this location better than my visits to the PV and Tempe locations.

Ztejas on Ray Road is one of my favorite places to have lunch.  The food is all made from scratch... did you know that?!  Great margaritas yes but no pressure to drink when sitting at the bar.  I could sit there for hours working on my laptop and the bartenders don't mind.  They have free wi fi now did you know that?! so many great things about this place.. It's never a disappointment.

Kudos for having a separate vegetarian menu -- it made it really easy to order. The chopped salad I had was decent, though more like a poor man's version of Burmese tea leaf salad. Minus one star for charging four bucks for chips & salsa.

Just had brunch for the third time here and it's was great. You can make your own bloody Mary with a variety of things the food it's delicious and the service it's great! Best thing it's every time we came here there is never a wait for a table and you get complimentary chips and salsa :)

Terrible food and mediocre service. Tap water is so disgusting it shouldn't be served to customers. My coffee creamer was so dirty it looked like it hadn't been washed. "clean" silverware wasn't even polished so it had water spots all over it. The "chef" here is just an egotistic glorified expediter who tells the line cooks when to fire another quesadilla and sifts through a book of rotating corporate specials and picks one and lacks any really creativity or talent. Definitely way better choices in the area

Great vibe, decent service and food was alright. I had the green chile barbacoa enchiladas. They were average, the black beans were tasty, the cojita cheese was a great topping. The rice tasted like it came from a box - needs a lot of work. I also tasted the steak fajitas. The steak was surprisingly good as it was tender, juicy, and seasoned well.

Stopped here for lunch with some co-workers on our way back to the office after an interview.  Was seated quickly and our server arrived shortly there after to take our drink order . . . drinks arrived and our order was immediately taken.  Quick service.

While waiting for our food we received a telephone call letting us know that we had gotten the project . . . whoo hoo a $13,000,000.00 school . . . just wat the doctor ordered.

Back to the food . . . it arrived quickly and hot . . . ordered the Chili Relleno . . . which tasted great, along with the corn bread.  So why only four stars you ask . . . I have to go back once the high from getting the new project wears off . . . just to verify that they do deserve five stars . . . didn't what my judgement clouded.

With that said . . . see you here again soon . . .
