The margs are the best.  Seems like the food is slipping a bit to me.   Stick to the Chopped Salad....its really good.  Their chips....yuck.   But the drinks are great.  Make me very happy.

As I live close to this location I am a frequent visitor. And every visit has proven to be a great one. The staff is always friendly and appear to be working hard. The food is always prompt and delicious. I almost always order the Fish Street Tacos and they NEVER disappoint. The queso is always a favorite too. Although I tend to pass on their guacamole. And if you're a margarita lover then you must try the Fusion Frozen Margarita. They top it off with fruit infused Patron and it is refreshing and strong! Don't have more than 3! I would always recommend this location to any friends and family!

I sat down at the bar an hour before closing for a late lite dinner. The bartender was very friendly and attentive. I ordered the chicken tortilla soup and it was delicious! I also had the ancho fudge pie. It tasted like a warm brownie with whipped cream on top, very yummmy. Overall, I had a good experience.
I've always had great service and hot food here. I really love the guac tostada bites and the diablo chicken pasta.

Awesome food. I will have to come back, I might increase to 5 stars. Service was a bit slow, but the food was incredible. Wild mushroom enchiladas and Smoked chicken chili rellenos..... Thank you sir may I have another. Prices are higher than average, but worth it if you want a outstanding Mexican/southwest meal. It has a very modern ambiance and decor. It can get crowded and loud.

My friend and I went to eat here while we were out of town with our kids.  The kids didn't really care either way about the food or service so I'll only talk about kid food quickly and just note what the adults observed and from two different prospective:

We were sat pretty quickly and given our menus.  I thought the menu was boring and lacked any kind of imagination.  My friend thought it was swell.  (Menu has brunch and 10 different kinds of Mexican food orders all "tex-mex" style).

They have a Bloody Mary bar and a Mimosa bar which is actually kinda cool and something that I had never seen before.  You order the booze, they bring it to you and you go to the bar and put in your fixins.  The offer different tomato juices, garnishes,  and spices for the Mary's and then OJ and different berries for the mimosas.  My friend got a Mimosa and had fun doing it.  I drank tea 'cause I don't dig on boozing it up before 6:00.  

The decor is pretty cool.  They are trying to be super up-scale but it's not really working.  It really just looks like any other chain I've ever been - it was nicer than say......a Chevy's but I wasn't horribly impressed.  My friend thought it was pretty neat and enjoyed the fun liquor bottle tree they had on display.  (Wrought Iron with empty bottles glued to the stems).

Okay - DRUM ROLL - Food time:

They serve cornbread where most places would serve chips and salsa.....I think that's weird.  My friend thought it was cool and said it was very tasty.  I'd just as soon have them take $2.00 off the bill and keep it away from me when my palate is gearing up for the Mexican dishes.

We both got the Smoked Chicken Enchiladas.  They totally don't come with quac and they charge $1.00 for it.  - NOT COOL.  The Enchiladas are not really Enchiladas.  They are two small soft shell taco tortillas with cheese and chicken in the middle of them.  Basically it's a $13.00 quesadilla.  It does come with rice and black beans and it does fill you up but it shouldn't be called an Enchilada.  I thought mine was just A-OK, bland and boring.   My friend got a chicken bone in hers.  It was pretty sizeable - probably about an inch long.

One kid got a burger which he liked.  The other kid got the poached eggs w/ potatoes.  He said the eggs were awesome but the potatoes were pretty poor and he wouldn't order them again.

My friend complained about the bone so the Manager took that entree off her bill and gave her a free slice of pie which was nice of him.

They have $10.00 tableside guac which is about 1/2 an avocado............huh.......all I'm saying is I can totally dice up 5 of my own avocados for that price.

I wouldn't go back.  I wanted to give this place 2 stars because the food was boring and the whole experience lacked anything worthy of memory retention.  I ended up giving it 3 because the Manager cared enough about bones to give away free pie.  

My friend hated this place and if it were up to her the review would be lower.  But it's my Yelp, not her's so 3 stars it is.

My rating is based on this first review... not on the second.

On my first visit to Z Tejas, I went at lunchtime with 2 guys from Boeing.  We had to sit at the bar since the restaurant was so crowded.  As I scanned the menu, the Grilled Green Chile Pork Enchiladas with green chile sauce and a tomato-avocado chopped salad caught my eye... and I'm glad it did.

I dont necessarily consider myself an 'enchilada' type of guy, but this dish provided me with the best I've ever tasted.  I recommend this dish, with no reservations.

Now for my second review.

My boss and I headed to Z Tejas today.  I figured that I'd mix it up and try something new.  Bad choice.

I was feeling a bit famished, so I ordered the more expensive menu item, which was Jack's Five-Cheese Macaroni Achiote.  The grilled chicken with bleu, Jack, cheddar, parmesan and romano cheeses and bacon gratin sounded like a complete winner.

Where to begin?

The dish incorporates real cheese, which I would normally find appetizing.  However, in this case, the entree was served piping hot, causing the cheese to string everywhere.  Kind of messy for a lunchtime meal.  

So, I ate slow, in hopes that the threadlike curd would solidify some.  Well, it did, but it also left, what can only be depicted as an oily scramble, in the bottom of the bowl, due to separation.  Delectable!

Well, I decided to ease up on the 'roni, and move on to the chicken, which was served with skin on.  Visually, the skin looked crispy... but I realized my peepers were punked when I chewed up on some rubbery epidermis.

Swoop Says: skip the mac 'n cheeze, go for the whole enchilada!


In other news, the server at the bar was top notch.  She refilled my palmer again and again, until my bladder shouted: 'Uncle!'.  When you need some pampering, saddle up to the bar.

BIRTHDAY BONUS: Signup for their birthday club and get an annual $10 coupon in your email.

~Swoop

It's close , usually pretty good , and fast .
I have several favorites that I almost always get.
The smoked chicken Chile Relleno is always good.

Popped in on a Saturday and  didn't know about the (new?)
Brunch thing going on.
Oh well, they had some interesting things, so I ordered a dish I had at Crackers Cafe on Elliott - that was super good there.
Migas.
Scrambled eggs, cheese, jalapeño or some kind of chilie, tortilla chips, all melted together.

Not.

Couldn't really discern where the eggs were, they had to be so dry... The whole thing was dry dry dry.
Cheese? What cheese? I saw nor tasted a scrap of cheese.

I ended up eating the potatoes - that were good , but not what id pay 9.50 for.

Pass this weak version and head the Crackers for a delicious take  on it.

But one more thing that really bugged me... The waitress was super sweet  and pretty good ; I did get the wrong muffin delivered, but since I liked both kinds it wasn't that big a deal.

BUT, the cornbread- that used to be free- is now on a donation program: if you "buy" it for $3.00, all proceeds go to a local charity.

Alone, the meal would be big enough. I really wanted no cornbread. 
BUT , she spent 30-45 seconds going over it, showing me the card explaining it (on table),
And telling me if I couldn't eat it they'd box it up for me!
Wow!
Really felt pushed to get this $3.00  bread I did not want.
I'm ashamed to admit I did order it. And she did box it. And I'll most likely throw is away.

Hey z tehas- show me card- let me read it, and decide on my own. No pressure!
I think they may have a contest for who sells more...
Sure felt like it.

So, fairly poor quality meal , and $3.00 wasted, while feeling first guilt, then frustration that I caved!
Damn.

I won't be back for brunch again!!

I'm officially back to loving Z'Tejas !!! They not only remade the menu, but they brought back the dumplings!!  the service from Matt at the Chandler location was perfect, and the food was back to AMAZING ...try the chefs special Chicken  fried sandwich. Z'Tejas you have us back, see you next week
Good Tex-Mex! Good Bar!

Came here for a friend's birthday dinner. There were 12 of us and our waiter took great care of us in spite of the group size. We asked for separate checks and he didn't show any signs of an attitude at all. At the end, when our checks came some of us realized he had forgotten to charge us for our sodas. When we pointed it out to him, he brushed it off and said, "If it's not on the bill, it won't be there at all. Don't worry about it!" Now if only all our waiters can forget about charging us for alcoholic beverages...

As for the food, my favorite was the free corn bread. Fresh from the oven, piping hot, sweet, with whole kernels of corn baked in and served in a mini baking pan. I could have eaten an entire pan of it and called it a night. In hindsight, that's what I should have done. The birthday girl suggested I try the Grilled Miso Salmon since she knows I LOVE seafood, adding that it was "pretty decent salmon considering we're in the middle of the desert." I'll also admit I'm not a big fan of Mexican food. Well, let's just say I'm sure there can be better salmon found in the middle of the desert than at Z'Tejas. The salmon was overcooked even though I asked for medium rare. The mashed potato cake on the side was just a lump of dry mashed potato that tasted like it was leftover and sitting in the fridge since last Thanksgiving. I definitely should have gone with a salad or Mexican dish.
Good place to come after work.  The appetizers on the happy hour menu are the way to go.  I was very disappointed in my seafood burrito - hardly any toppings at all!

We usually dine in when we eat at Z'Tejas, but this time decided to place a to go order.  The hostess sent me to the bar to pick it up, which I hate.  As usual when this happens, I stood at the bar with my thumb up my a$$ waiting to get the bartender's attention.  He was super busy while the hostess went back to her podium to do absolutely nothing.

The food here is decent.  One dish I highly recommend is the diablo chicken.  If not for this dish, I probably wouldn't eat there as often though.  The corn bread is a nice touch and they're not stingy about bringing more.

I'm kind of middle of the road when it comes to Z.  I think they're OK for happy hour, though their drinks aren't that great of a deal, but you don't need too many either.  Ada G. is addicted to their Chambord Margaritas and recreates them at home for us too.  As for their other food.  I've had a salad I liked and some apps were good but I've generally been a little disappointed with the rest.  My friend B's husband used to be a bartender at Scottsdale so once upon a time, we put in many Friday nights at the bar, sampling the wares.  Nowadays I just go for a "normal" happy hour and I'm not having to drive back to her house Sunday afternoon to get my car.  I'd have to say it's a much kinder, gentler approach.  Try them for happy hour.  Sit on the patio, enjoy the weather (unless it's summer) and have a margarita and some tostada bites.  I think you'll enjoy it.

Horrible, horrible, horrible! Do NOT waste your time or hard earned money here. This restaurant has been having issues for at least the last year.

It's been about a year since my last visit and I decided to give it another try. Wow, big mistake. We got to the restaurant about 1:00 pm, well after the lunch rush. Although something tells me they don't get big crowds. The restaurant was pretty quiet, not many patrons. We got seated at a booth by a window which was nice. After that the whole experience sucked.

The waiter finally came to take our order. About 20 minutes later he came by the table and I asked about our food. Did they need to go to the store and buy it? And then prep it all? The restaurant was uncrowded. Why was it taking so long?

Surprise! He immediately comes out with the food. And guess what? It was COLD! I was not happy, but since I hadn't eaten anything all day and was starving, I ate it. 

It was really gross to eat something cold that would've been so delicious if served hot.  At least the food temp went up to 98.6 once it got inside my tummy. Oh, and the waiter, Ryan, never apologized or gave us a reason for the delay.  Clearly it had been ready for a while and he neglected to get it.  Terrible service.  He never once came by to ask us how it was, as is customary in most restaurants.  Probably because he knew he messed up big time. 

I did not see any manager on duty, which may be part of the problem. This restaurant has been in decline for quite some time now. It's sad because it used to be a great place and now it just SUCKS!

And I have to mention that my husband's burger looked quite red inside.  Definitely NOT medium well as ordered.

Please do yourself a favor and go anywhere else but here. Not worth the frustration and the food's not cheap either.

If I could give it zero stars I would.
Crazy good value. Super Happy Hour. Tasty food.  Friendly and fast service. Highly recommended!  Living off the appetizer menu works wonders. Even the cole slaw is awesome!

Z'Tejas is your typical "higher end" chain restaurant. Good for families or casual yet sit-down meals. They do southwestern, tex mex, with a good mix of seafood, too. 

I really liked the the corn bread that's complimentary..haha! Super warm, fluffy and delicious.

Weak wine list, but good margaritas/drinks. Service was great - our servers were constantly checking on us!

 Overall, a decent option in Chandler, especially for groups of 2-6 people. Lots of the food is shareable.
Upper level Mexican food. Very flavorful. Large portions! The environment was loud. I had the chicken diablo with shrimp and it was delicious .

I went here yesterday for lunch. I had no idea what to expect from this place.

We ordered the chips and salsa. I also ordered the smoked duck tacos. 

The server was nice and attentive to us. When we arrived, it was around 2pm so it was pretty empty.

Since this is a mexican restaurant, I was expecting different items on the menu. Well, it is a chain so it seems more of Mexican fusion than real Mexican food. 

The chips and salsa came with three different types of salsa (one green one that had some avocado and two red ones [one was spicy and one was mild]). The salsa was good but nothing exceptionally. The chips were nicely crispy and they came in two colors.

The cornbread is buttery and filling. It is soft and I can taste little bits of corn in it. It comes with a side of butter but I didn't add butter to it because I felt like it had enough flavor. The cornbread comes out hot and fresh.

My smoked duck tacos were good. I like the side of slaw with it, it gave a fresh crisp to it. The marinade for the duck tacos were a little overpowering. They definitely did give a lot of duck sauce. The plating was nice, it was on a long rectangular plate. It was a little difficult to eat on such a skinny plate. The tortilla was nicely crisp and not too soft so it made it easier to eat. The sauce seems like a mayo-based sauce on top. It was good. I did wish they gave us more slaw on the side though. I like the duck meat although they had lots of sauce on it.

Parking is in the parking lot so parking is easy.

+Good cornbread
-Not real mexican food, so if you want real mexican food, this is not the place to come too
+Plating is nice
+Service is attentive

This place has the best happy hour ever. I highly recommend the pork nachos. They are delicious and a steal at happy hour. The atmosphere is fun but can be a little loud.  The open layout is nicely done though.

Don't show up early and before your entire party is at the restaurant. They will not seat you at a table unless half your party is present.

Oh, okay....I guess I won't spend more money on a drink and appetizer while wait. Makes no sense.

Update--------

Within 10 minutes of posting my review, the manager Steve came over and apologized for the treatment I experienced. The host that I had dealt with was new and had confused their Friday night seating policy. Steve promised to review the policy at their host/hostess meeting the next day.

After our meal Steve offered free deserts to our entire table.

Feel much better about this place.

Now I know where to go for a really good catfish beignets! Warm customer service, nice atmosphere, very tasty street tacos and grilled shrimp guacamole tostada bites.
Happy hour is the bomb!

I haven't been here since I first turned 21, and I'm almost 30, but that was the scottsdale location. Ouch, sorry it's been so long!! I'm upset I haven't been back sooner.

The man and I wanted to grab some dinner before hitting the casino for some gambling, and when I turned onto Ray Rd and saw Ztejas, I was sold. I knew what I wanted to drink, obviously the chambord frozen margaritas, because that's what I remembered from my first visit. They did not disappoint! 

The man wanted to order the corn bread, and it came out hot, delicious with soft butter. Yum! I wanted the shrimp guacamole tostada bites, and I wanted more of them after that first order but we decided on sharing the chicken avocado sandwich with sweet potato fries. The chicken was so hot, juicy and tender, and the flavors were on point! The sweet potato fries came out a minute after the sandwich but for good reason, FRESH! 

The bartender was so nice, and kept our drinks full and is fast and efficient. Didn't catch his name, but don't loose that guy as a bartender.

Had a great experience here last night with my sweet friend. We use to go to this place all the time at the Scottsdale mall location. This was our first time going to this Chandler location and boy was it lovely!
 We came kinda close to closing time. Around 8:15pm( they close at 9pm).
 Our server was very friendly, attentive and nice which is always a huge plus.
We were brought out chips and salsa for starters. I am not much of a chip girl but these chips were really well made and the salsa was quite tasty.  We also ordered a round of there cornbread because it is really yummy. 
For entrees we both have our tradition of ordering the mushroom enchiladas. I know this may not sound appetizing to some but it is actually quite amazing even if you don't love mushrooms.  The food came out super quick it was awesome. 
The prossecco they had in stock was high quality and we were brought little fruit cups at the end. 
Overall we had  such a nice experience I am glad to hear they have a location in Austin Texas!

Waiting 30 minutes to get water another 45 five minute to get my food no thanks there are better place in town with better service. If it wasn't because of my friend s birthday I would of walked out long time ago. It is seems like employee doesn't care about this establishment and want this place to fail.

Visited Z'Tejas last Thursaday night.  After a flight, getting settled in, my wife and I ventured out on a very hot August evening.

Greeted kindly at the door, got to our seats, welcomed by our server, McKenna.  She was kind and talkative and inquired about our day.   More so than most, which made me feel a bit more connected to the experience.

The food was all very good (not super duper, but very good).  Wasn't sure what to expect as it's a new chain that I've never visited.  I ordered the turkey burger, and side salad, my wife ordered the Ahi tacos.  The table cornbread was fresh and yummy.  We also ordered table-side quac.  Well prepared, again by our server.

The bar looked entertaining with a beautiful Tequila Tree.  Wasn't in the mood for a drink but certainly would next time.  

Everything was pretty good!  Would certainly return.

Let's be clear, I'm giving 4 stars because of the awesome, yummy and STRONG chambord margaritas!  Love them!  You only need 2 of these delectable delights to get your blood flowing (really, you only need 1).  The food alone would get a solid 3 stars for me -- consistently decent, but not great.  I usually get the street tacos or the tostada bites when I go for happy hour.  

Happy hour on Fridays is always packed.  Get there early to get seating in the bar!

Great food, attentive service!!  Must go to when in Chandler!! I ordered the salmon and it was delicious. Also had the margarita at happy hour which was a great price and a top notch drink. Our waiter was great as well as the manager who stopped by our table to check in with us. Very impressed!  Will definitely return!

First time here and enjoyed it very much.   Nice upscale decor but very noisy. You will be greeted with a small skillet of very good cornbread with whipped butter.  They have an extensive menu with many unique items. Had a Margarita for $5 from the happy hour menu (weekdays 2 - 7).  For my entree, I chose the Anciote chopped chicken salad.  An interesting choice. The grilled anchored chicken was seasoned and cooked expertly.    It was placed on top of shredded iceberg, Roma tomatoes, red cabbage, cotija corn, black olives and pepitas.  Each in it's own section of the salad platter.  Oh, and I almost forgot, we had the Tejas Trio from the happy hour appetizer menu consisting of salsa, cheese sauce Nd guacamole.  Good Stuff!  The service was great with our server actually boxing our leftovers for us along with extra chips.  Nicely done!

I absolutely love this place it's my favorite restaurant in Arizona! It's also a great place to bring visitors in town. We love sitting at the bar and getting their world-class margaritas! Plus bonus the bartenders are fantastic as well as the waitstaff! We split the tableside guacamole along with the ribeye with blue cheese and caramelized onion sauce and they're both phenomenal! Their z  salad is so amazing for such a simple salad we love it with the red wine vinaigrette dressing! Other dishes we've enjoyed in the past are the Diablo chicken pasta, the chili rellano and the achiote chicken chopped salad! Our favorite margarita has become the paradise where they add extra shot of grand Marnier! Perfect place for a date night or for a fun afternoon happy hour! Love love love

Only downfall would be they seemed to up their prices on both the menu and happy hour... At least get back to good hh prices cause that's a huge draw!

We haven't been here for awhile but were SO happy to revisit. Our meal from start to finish was top-notch and our server couldn't have been more helpful or friendly. Darn, I wish I could remember his name - a clever nickname that I swore I'd remember. Oh, well - he was amazing. Our fresh guacamole was terrific and that cornbread is always cooked to perfection. Can't get enough! Our margaritas were dynamite too. I ordered the ruby trout and it was spectacular. Loved the sides as well. My friend ordered the stacked enchilada and that was flavorful too. I don't think you could go wrong with just about anything on this menu. Oh, and Happy Hour prices are very affordable. Thanks!!
GREAT PLACE!!!!  Love the happy hour when I can make it.....  The street tacos are fantastic.   My family and I haven't had anything we wouldn't eat again here.  The bartenders are Awesome!
My girlfriend and I love this place. It's clean and the staff are friendly. And of course, the food is great. Try the avocado chicken sandwich, the bread is phenomenal!

Went for dinner during happy hour.  Very good $5 margaritas...loved the patron fruzion.  The others I tried were ok...chambord was way too sweet for me.  The app and dinner were very good!  Will be back soon!
